hwVectoringMIB.name: hwVectoringMIB

revisions.description: V1.03, changes in this revision: Add the definition of the nodes: hwVectoringReceivedESRecoverAlarmTrap, hwVectoringPSConfigAbnormalAlarmTrap, hwVectoringPSConfigRecoverAlarmTrap in hwVectoringTraps.

V1.02, changes in this revision: Add leaf node hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand and hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand. Create table hwVectoringFastJoinConfig and hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable. Add leaf node hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsDs and hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsUs. Add leaf node hwVectoringLinkCPEType to get the CPE type connected to the port. Add leaf node hwVectoringGlobalConfigChangeTrap to notify the change vectoring global configuration. Create table hwVectoringCommonTraps to fetch the vectoring traps. Add leaf node hwVectoringGlobalConfigChangeTrap. Add leaf node hwVectoringVictCoefAbnormalVariationAlarmTrap, hwVectoringDistCoefAbnormalVariationAlarmTrap, hwVectoringReceivedESAbnormalAlarmTrap, hwvdsl2LegacyCpeActivatedAlarmTrap and hwvdsl2FrequentlyRetrainTimesReachThresholdAlarmTrap. Modify the node hwVectoringGroupIndex, hwVectoringLinkBelongedVceId and hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex. Create table hwVectoringTrapsVbOids. Add leaf node hwVectoringPortFrequentRetrainTimes. delete unnecessary en dashes. Add the definition of the table hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable, hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable, hwVectoringAlarmTraps. add value forceFriendlyDsLimitUs(4) and forceFriendlyDsNoLimitUs(5) for hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy and modify the description .

V1.01, changes in this revision: Add the definition of the table: hwVectoringGroupTable, hwVectoringConfProfTable, hwVectoringPortTable. Add the definition of the nodes: hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy in hwVectoringGlobalConfig. Add the definition of the nodes: hwVectoringLinkBandPlanCompatible in hwVectoringPortTable. Add the definition of the nodes: hwVectoringBandplanType, hwVectoringUs0Type, hwVectoringAnnexALimitMask in hwVectoringGlobalConfig.

hwVectoringMIB.contactinfo: Huawei Industrial Base Bantian, Longgang Shenzhen 518129 People's Republic of China Website: http://www.huawei.com Email: support@huawei.com
hwVectoringMIB.description: This mib is used for defining huawei's vectoring management MIB objects. The MIB is used for vectoring, vectoring is a transmission method that employs the coordination of line signals for reduction of crosstalk levels and improvement of performance.

hwVectoringSwitch.name: hwVectoringSwitch
hwVectoringSwitch.description: Enable/Disable the global vectoring configuration. Default values:disable. Options: 1. enable(1) - Enables the global vectoring configuration 2. disable(2) - Disables the global vectoring configuration

hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy.name: hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy
hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy.description: Vectoring legacy cpe activate policy. Default values:limit. Options: 1. no-limit(1) - The legacy cpe is allowed to activated in G.993.2 operation mode 2. block(2) - The legacy cpe is not allowed to activated in G.993.2 operation mode 3. limit(3) - The legacy cpe is allowed to activated in G.993.2 operation mode, with PSD auto shaped to eliminate the self-FEXT to vectoring lines 4. forceFriendlyDsLimitUs(4) - Force friendly is used in the downstream direction, and PSD automatic shaping is used in the upstream direction 5. forceFriendlyDsNoLimitUs(5) - Force friendly is used in the downstream direction, and no restriction is set for the upstream direction

hwVectoringBandplanType.name: hwVectoringBandplanType
hwVectoringBandplanType.description: Vectoring global frequency plan types. Default values:bandplan998ade. Options: 1. bandplanAnnexa(1) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is Annex A 2. bandplanAnnexc(2) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is Annex C 3. bandplan997e(3) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is 997E 4. bandplan998ade(4) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is 998ADE 5. bandplan998e(5) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is 998E 6. bandplanHPE(6) - The frequency plan types for the vectoring feature is HPE

hwVectoringUs0Type.name: hwVectoringUs0Type
hwVectoringUs0Type.description: Vectoring us0 type. Default values:us0TypeA. Options: 1. us0TypeA(1) - US0 type is US0-type A 2. us0TypeB(2) - US0 type is US0-type B 3. us0TypeM(3) - US0 type is US0-type M 4. us0TypeN(4) - US0 type is US0-type N/A 5. invalidValue(-1) - US0 type return -1 when vectoring frequency plan types is Annex A/Annex C

hwVectoringAnnexALimitMask.name: hwVectoringAnnexALimitMask
hwVectoringAnnexALimitMask.description: AnnexA limit mask. Options: 1. d32(1) - AnnexA limit mask is D-32 2. d48(2) - AnnexA limit mask is D-48 3. d64(3) - AnnexA limit mask is D-64 4. d128(4) - AnnexA limit mask is D-128 5. invalidValue(-1) - AnnexA limit mask return -1 when vectoring frequency plan types is not Annex A

hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand.name: hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand
hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand.description: This object is used to set the reserved band of a legacy CPE. This object takes effect when hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy is set to limit. Range of the subcarrier IDs: 0-6956. Two subcarriers are separated by a comma (,). The format is: start subcarrier ID-end subcarrier ID. The start subcarrier ID cannot be greater than the end subcarrier ID. Only eight reserved band is supported, for example, 880-900,1000-1100. The settings of hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand and hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand cannot overlap with each other.

hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand.name: hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand
hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand.description: This object is used to set the blackout band of a legacy CPE. This object takes effect when hwVectoringLegacyCpeActivatePolicy is set to limit. Range of the subcarrier IDs: 0-6956. Two subcarriers are separated by a comma (,). The format is: start subcarrier ID-end subcarrier ID. The start subcarrier ID cannot be greater than the end subcarrier ID. Only eight tone blackout band is supported, for example, 1300-1320,1400-1500. The settings of hwVectoringLegacyCpeReservedBand and hwVectoringLegacyCpeToneBlackoutBand cannot overlap with each other.

hwVectoringGroupTable.name: hwVectoringGroupTable
hwVectoringGroupTable.description: The table hwVectoringGroupTable contains the vectoring group configuration. The index of this table is hwVectoringGroupIndex.

hwVectoringGroupEntry.name: hwVectoringGroupEntry
hwVectoringGroupEntry.description: The table hwVectoringGroupTable contains the vectoring group configuration. The index of this entry is hwVectoringGroupIndex.

hwVectoringGroupIndex.name: hwVectoringGroupIndex
hwVectoringGroupIndex.description: This object identifies a row in this table.

hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsUs.name: hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsUs
hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsUs.description: This configuration parameter shall be an array of pairs of sub-carrier indices for uptream . Each pair represents the start and stop sub-carrier index of a frequency band in which FEXT cancellation is not required. Up to 8 frequency bands may be configured. for example :880-900,1000-1020

hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsDs.name: hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsDs
hwVectoringGroupNotReqBandsDs.description: This configuration parameter shall be an array of pairs of sub-carrier indices for downstream . Each pair represents the start and stop sub-carrier index of a frequency band in which FEXT cancellation is not required. Up to 8 frequency bands may be configured. for example :1300-1320,1400-1450

hwVectoringGroupLinkList.name: hwVectoringGroupLinkList
hwVectoringGroupLinkList.description: This object defines the link list of the vectoring group. This is a string of 4 bytes of values indicates the port ifindex. It can contain as most as 512 link.

hwVectoringGroupRowStatus.name: hwVectoringGroupRowStatus
hwVectoringGroupRowStatus.description: This object is used to create a new row or delete an existing row in this table.

hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsD.name: hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsDs
hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsD.description: This object enable/disable the protection of vectoring lines downstream. Options: 1. enable(1)- The protection of vectoring lines downstream is enabled 2. disable(2) - The protection of vectoring lines downstream is disabled

hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsU.name: hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsUs
hwVectoringGroupProtectionOfNotReqBandsU.description: This object enable/disable the protection of vectoring lines upstream. Options: 1. enable(1)- The protection of vectoring lines upstream is enabled 2. disable(2) - The protection of vectoring lines upstream is disabled

hwVectoringConfProfTable.name: hwVectoringConfProfTable
hwVectoringConfProfTable.description: The table hwVectoringConfProfTable contains the vectoring profile configuration. A default profile with an index of 'DEFVAL' will always exist and its parameters will be set to vendor-specific values, unless otherwise specified in this document. The index of this table is hwVectoringProfName.

hwVectoringConfProfEntry.name: hwVectoringConfProfEntry
hwVectoringConfProfEntry.description: The table hwVectoringConfProfTable contains the vectoring profile configuration. A default profile with an index of 'DEFVAL' will always exist and its parameters will be set to vendor-specific values, unless otherwise specified in this document. The index of this entry is hwVectoringProfName.

hwVectoringProfName.name: hwVectoringProfName
hwVectoringProfName.description: This object identifies a row in this table.

hwVectoringEnableUs.name: hwVectoringEnableUs
hwVectoringEnableUs.description: Enable/Disable FEXT cancellation control upstream. Default values: enable. Options: 1. enable(1) - Enable FEXT cancellation in the upstream direction from all the other vectoring lines into the line in the vectoring group 2. disable(2) - Disable FEXT cancellation in the upstream direction from all the other vectoring lines into the line in the vectoring group.

hwVectoringEnableDs.name: hwVectoringEnableDs
hwVectoringEnableDs.description: Enable/Disable FEXT cancellation control downstream. Default values: enable. Options: 1. enable(1) - Enable FEXT cancellation in the downstream direction from all the other vectoring lines into the line in the vectoring group 2. disable(2) - Disable FEXT cancellation in the downstream direction from all the other vectoring lines into the line in the vectoring group

hwVectoringProfRowStatus.name: hwVectoringProfRowStatus
hwVectoringProfRowStatus.description: This object is used to create a new row or delete an existing row in this table. Before a profile can be deleted, it must be not referenced from all VDSL ports.

hwVectoringPortTable.name: hwVectoringPortTable
hwVectoringPortTable.description: The table hwVectoringPortTable contains port configuration about vectoring. The index of this table is ifIndex.

hwVectoringPortEntry.name: hwVectoringPortEntry
hwVectoringPortEntry.description: The table hwVectoringPortTable contains port configuration about vectoring. The index of this entry is ifIndex.

hwVectoringLinkCfgProf.name: hwVectoringLinkCfgProf
hwVectoringLinkCfgProf.description: This object configures the vectoring link profile name.

hwVectoringLinkBelongedVceId.name: hwVectoringLinkBelongedVceId
hwVectoringLinkBelongedVceId.description: The VCE ID uniquely identifies the VCE that manages and controls the vectored group to which the line belongs. It consists of one octet and valid ranges are from 1 to 96. The special value 0 means the line is not in a vectored group.

hwVectoringLinkVcePortIndex.name: hwVectoringLinkVcePortIndex
hwVectoringLinkVcePortIndex.description: The VCE port index is the physical index that uniquely identifies the VCE port to which the line is connected. It is an integer from 1 to the maximum number of lines supported by the VCE. The special value 0 means the VCE port index is not valid

hwVectoringLinkBandPlanCompatible.name: hwVectoringLinkBandPlanCompatible
hwVectoringLinkBandPlanCompatible.description: Options: 1. compatible(1) - The vectoring line configured band plan is compatible with the vectoring band configuration 2. incompatible(2) - The vectoring line configured band plan is not compatible with the vectoring band configuration

hwVectoringLinkCPEType.name: hwVectoringLinkCPEType
hwVectoringLinkCPEType.description: Options: 1. vectoring(1) - The CPE type is vectoring 2. fullFriendly(2) - The CPE type is vectoring full friendly 3. friendlyDs(3) - The CPE type is vectoring friendly ds 4. legacyVdsl2(4) - The CPE type is vdsl2 5. adsl(5) - The CPE type is adsl/2/2+ 6. unknown(6) - The CPE type is unknown

hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable.name: hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable
hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable.description: The table hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable contains the vectoring auto group result. The indexes of this table are hwVectoringGroupIndex and hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex.

hwVectoringAutoGroupingEntry.name: hwVectoringAutoGroupingEntry
hwVectoringAutoGroupingEntry.description: The table hwVectoringAutoGroupingTable contains the vectoring auto group result. The indexes of this entry are hwVectoringGroupIndex and hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex.

hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex.name: hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex
hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupIndex.description: This object identifies auto group index.

hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupLinkList.name: hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupLinkList
hwVectoringAutoGroupingGroupLinkList.description: This object defines the link list of the vectoring auto group. This is a string of 4 bytes of values indicates the port ifindex. It can contain as most as 512 link.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable.description: The table hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable contains information of vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix about a port in a vectoring group. The indexes of this table are ifIndex and hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixDirection.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixEntry.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixEntry
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixEntry.description: The table hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixTable contains information of vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix about a port in a vectoring group. The indexes of this entry are ifIndex and hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixDirection.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixDirect.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixDirection
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixDirect.description: The direction of the vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix either upstream or downstream.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperTyp.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperType
hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperTyp.description: This object is used to start the vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix. Options: 1. start(1) - start the vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix 2. stop(2) - stop the vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix

hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperRes.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperResult
hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperRes.description: This object identifies the crosstalk coupling matrix operation result. Options: 1. normal(1) - The crosstalk coupling matrix operation result is normal. 2. fail(2) - The crosstalk coupling matrix operation result is fail.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixPortIf.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixPortIfindexList
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixPortIf.description: Ifindex list of port that effect another port in the same vectoring group. This is a string of 4 bytes of values indicates the port ifindex.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixAverag.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixAverageMagnitudeList
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixAverag.description: In this matrix must be seen all vectoring subscribers with disturberline. This is a string of 4 bytes of values indicates the port average magnitude. The units is 0.1 dBm/Hz.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixCancel.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixCancellationStatusList
hwVectoringCrosstalkCouplingMatrixCancel.description: This is a string of 1 bytes of values indicates the port crosstalk another. The byte value indicates: 1. yes(1) - counteract 2. no(2) - not counteract 3. invalidValue(-1) - invalid value

hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateTable.name: hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateTable
hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateTable.description: The table hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateTable contains the vectoring current running information. The indexes of this table are hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.

hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateEntry.name: hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateEntry
hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateEntry.description: The table hwVectoringBoardVectoringStateTable contains the vectoring current running information. The indexes of this entry are hwFrameIndex and hwSlotIndex.

hwVectoringVpVectoringInterfaceState.name: hwVectoringVpVectoringInterfaceState
hwVectoringVpVectoringInterfaceState.description: The object indicates VCE vectoring interface state. Options: 1. down(1) - vectoring interface state is abnormal 2. up(2) - vectoring interface state is normal 3. invalidValue(-1) - invalid value

hwVectoringVdslVectoringInterfaceState.name: hwVectoringVdslVectoringInterfaceState
hwVectoringVdslVectoringInterfaceState.description: The object indicates VDSL vectoring interface state. Options: 1. down(1) - vectoring interface state is abnormal 2. up(2) - vectoring interface state is normal 3. invalidValue(-1) - invalid value

hwVectoringVdslVectoringSyncState.name: hwVectoringVdslVectoringSyncState
hwVectoringVdslVectoringSyncState.description: The object indicates Sync state between VCE and VDSL vectoring interface. Options: 1. noSync(1) - communication between VCE and VDSL is abnormal 2. sync(2) - communication between VCE and VDSL is normal 3. invalidValue(-1) - invalid value

hwVectoringFaultAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringFaultAlarmTrap
hwVectoringFaultAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the vectoring service on the board fails.

hwVectoringRecoveryAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringRecoveryAlarmTrap
hwVectoringRecoveryAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the vectoring service on the board recovers.

hwVectoringVictCoefAbnormalVariationAlar.name: hwVectoringVictCoefAbnormalVariationAlarmTrap
hwVectoringVictCoefAbnormalVariationAlar.description: This notification indicates that the port receives abnormal crosstalk from other ports.

hwVectoringDistCoefAbnormalVariationAlar.name: hwVectoringDistCoefAbnormalVariationAlarmTrap
hwVectoringDistCoefAbnormalVariationAlar.description: This notification indicates that the port causes abnormal crosstalk to other ports.

hwVectoringReceivedESAbnormalAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringReceivedESAbnormalAlarmTrap
hwVectoringReceivedESAbnormalAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the port receives abnormal error sample messages.

hwvdsl2LegacyCpeActivatedAlarmTrap.name: hwvdsl2LegacyCpeActivatedAlarmTrap
hwvdsl2LegacyCpeActivatedAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the port is activated in none-vectoring mode.

hwvdsl2FrequentlyRetrainTimesReachThresh.name: hwvdsl2FrequentlyRetrainTimesReachThresholdAlarmTrap
hwvdsl2FrequentlyRetrainTimesReachThresh.description: This notification indicates that the port frequently retrain times in 15 minutes reach the threshold.

hwVectoringReceivedESRecoverAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringReceivedESRecoverAlarmTrap
hwVectoringReceivedESRecoverAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the port error sample feedback recovers.

hwVectoringPSConfigAbnormalAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringPSConfigAbnormalAlarmTrap
hwVectoringPSConfigAbnormalAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the port receives abnormal pilot Sequence messages.

hwVectoringPSConfigRecoverAlarmTrap.name: hwVectoringPSConfigRecoverAlarmTrap
hwVectoringPSConfigRecoverAlarmTrap.description: This notification indicates that the port pilot sequence recovers.

hwVectoringGlobalConfigChangeTrap.name: hwVectoringGlobalConfigChangeTrap
hwVectoringGlobalConfigChangeTrap.description: This notification indicates that the vectoring global configuration is changed.

hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperRes.name: hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperResultTrap
hwVectoringCrosstalkCoupingMatrixOperRes.description: This notification indicates that the vectoring crosstalk coupling matrix calculation result.

hwVectoringGainPhase.name: hwVectoringGainPhase
hwVectoringGainPhase.description: This object is used to set the mode for obtaining the vectoring gain during port activation. Default values:atInit. Options: 1. atInit(1) - The vectoring gain is obtained during port activation except board startup 2. trigger(2) - The vectoring gain is obtained in some condition 3. duringShowtime(3) - The port is activated and then the vectoring gain is obtained during tracking

hwVectoringTriggerAfterBoardReset.name: hwVectoringTriggerAfterBoardReset
hwVectoringTriggerAfterBoardReset.description: The vectoring gain is not obtained during port activation in board reset, but obtained during tracking in SRA. Default values:enable. Options: 1. enable(1) - Enables the vectoring gain achieved in showtime after board reset 2. disable(2) - Disables the vectoring gain achieved in showtime after board reset 3. invalidValue(-1) - invalid value

hwVectoringTriggerDuringBulkNum.name: hwVectoringTriggerDuringBulkNum
hwVectoringTriggerDuringBulkNum.description: The vectoring gain achieved in showtime when the number of ports join in at a time exceeds the configured bulk init number. It ranges from 2 to 256. The invalid value is 4294967295. Default values:64.

hwVectoringJoinMaxWaitTime.name: hwVectoringJoinMaxWaitTime
hwVectoringJoinMaxWaitTime.description: This object is used to set the total time for a joined port to wait for other ports in the batch to join. Default values:15.

hwVectoringJoinGapWaitTime.name: hwVectoringJoinGapWaitTime
hwVectoringJoinGapWaitTime.description: This object is used to set the interval for a joined port to wait for a single port in the batch to join. Default values:5.

hwVectoringHistoryCoefficient.name: hwVectoringHistoryCoefficient
hwVectoringHistoryCoefficient.description: This object is used to set whether to use a historical coefficient. Default values:both. Options: 1. disable(1) - Indicates that a historical coefficient is not used 2. upstream(2) - Indicates that a historical coefficient is used in upstream direction 3. downstream(3) - Indicates that a historical coefficient is used in downstream direction 4. both(4) - Indicates that a historical coefficient is used

hwVectoringPortFrequentRetrainTimes.name: hwVectoringPortFrequentRetrainTimes
hwVectoringPortFrequentRetrainTimes.description: The times that Xdsl port frequent retrain in 15 minutes.
